nodes.bodyText: That's a curious magical number. Is that a function of something?

It was simply the minimum amount of height I could use such that the top of the text of the buttons wasn't cut off. It didn't arise from anything directly other than that - all I did was walk it down 1px at a time in the browser until the whole text was visible.

Mostly this file uses rem units when dealing with fonts and lines. Any chance we could do the same here? There's a chance the value may then (and probably should) correlate with one of the typography mixins.
Yup, sure thing. I'll fix that up.

This 97% rings a bell. We've seen that in here before and then seen it removed as it wasn't really needed - could've been somewhere else. But, it raises the question, do we need this and how fragile will that 3% buffer be?

So what it was originally was 99% - if set to 100% then the comment section is flush with the edge of the card, with no margin which I assume is why 99 was chosen to give a bit of faux padding. However that seemed to be misaligned, it didn't line up with anything. Taking it back 2 percent on this page made it line up nicely. That doesn't apply however to the comment section in the regular item summary page - 97 is close to aligned there but slightly off, because that page doesn't have the selection panel and the widths are different. So it highlights fragility.
So yes - here it is needed, or an equivalent. But the way it is set up in general is kinda strange.
I should note that this selector specifically applies to the comment section in a selection session in an item summary. It doesn't affect anywhere else.

Did you notice that 4px is now in this file 155 times! 🤯
I wonder what it means. I can see it's half of $singleMargin but I'm not sure that's what it's representing. Feels more like it's a minimal buffer, minimal padding.... Not sure. 🤔
Wouldn't it be great to tidy that up.

Its actually 90 times - you need a space at the start of your CTRL F so that you don't include 84px, etc. Still though I see the point.
I've scanned through them all and they are all used for padding and margins, with the odd exception of a border-radius every now and then.
If you'd like I could refactor this in this PR? Something like $halfMargin, $minimalPadding, $smallMargin, $minSpacingBuffer. I could just have another one for the border-radius stuff. $standardBorderRadius.
